content.text:
# Endorsements in the 2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries

This is a list of endorsements for declared candidates in the Democratic primaries for the 2020 United States presidential election.
Joe Biden
Withdrawn candidates
Michael Bennet
U.S. representatives
* Jared Golden, U.S. representative from ME-2 since 2019
Governors
* John Hickenlooper, former governor of Colorado (2011–2019), former 2020 presidential candidate, and 2020 U.S. Senate candidate
* Bill Ritter, former governor of Colorado (2007–2011)
* Roy Romer, former governor of Colorado (1987–1999) and distinguished party leader as former DNC chair
State officials
* Joan Bolin Betts, former deputy treasurer of Iowa and former assistant attorney general of Iowa ''(previously endorsed Beto O'Rourke)
* Phil Weiser, attorney general of Colorado since 2019
State legislators
* Bob Backus, New Hampshire state representative from the Hillsborough 19th District since 2012
* Michael Cahill, New Hampshire state representative from Rockingham District 17 since 2012
* Sherry Dutzy, New Hampshire state representative from the Hillsborough 30th District since 2018
* Joyce Fulweiler, New Hampshire state representative from the Merrimack 3rd District since 2018
* Matt Gray, Colorado state representative from District 33 since 2017
* Peter Groff, former Colorado state senator from District 33 (2003–2009) and president of the Colorado State Senate (2007–2009); former Colorado state representative from District 7 (2001–2003); former director for the Faith Based and Neighborhood Partnerships Center at the U.S. Department of Education (2009–2010)
* David Luneau, New Hampshire state representative from the Merrimack 10th District since 2014
* Dylan Roberts, Colorado state representative from District 26 since 2017
* Marjorie Smith, New Hampshire state representative from the Strafford 6th District since 2012
* Gary Woods, New Hampshire state representative from Merrimack District 23 since 2018
Local officials
* Michael Hancock, mayor of Denver, Colorado since 2011 (previously endorsed John Hickenlooper)
* Wellington Webb, former mayor of Denver, Colorado (1991–2003) (previously endorsed John Hickenlooper)''
* Patrick White, former Johnson County district attorney, Iowa (1982–2006)
Party officials
* James Carville, political science professor, political analyst and media commentator, and head strategist of Bill Clinton's presidential campaign in 1992
Individuals
* Paul LeBlanc, president of Southern New Hampshire University since 2004
State officials
* Tom Miller, attorney general of Iowa since 1995 and 1979–1991 (endorsed Joe Biden after Bullock withdrew from the race)
State legislators
* Staci Appel, former Iowa state senator for District 37 (2007–2011) (endorsed Joe Biden after Bullock withdrew from the race)
* Bruce Bearinger, Iowa state representative for District 63 since 2013 (endorsed Amy Klobuchar after Bullock withdrew from the race)
* Bill Gannon, former Iowa state representative for District 66 (1965–1971) and former House Minority Floor Leader (endorsed Amy Klobuchar after Bullock withdrew from the race)
Local officials
*Marty Pottebaum, Woodbury County supervisor from 3rd District, Iowa (2016–present)
Party officials
* Jan M. Bauer, former Story County, Iowa Democratic Party chair (1997–2019) and DNC member
Individuals
* Scooter Braun, businessman and co-organizer of March for Our Lives
* Jeff Bridges, actor
* Jeffrey Katzenberg, film producer
}}
Pete Buttigieg
Julian Castro
(endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
U.S. representatives
* Colin Allred, U.S. representative from TX-32 since 2019 (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Joaquin Castro, U.S. representative from TX-20 since 2013; Castro's twin brother (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Vicente Gonzalez, U.S. representative from TX-15 since 2017 (switched endorsement to Biden)
State legislators
* Roberto Alonzo, former Texas state representative from District 104 (1993–2019) (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Rafael Anchia, Texas state representative from District 103 since 2005 (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Diego Bernal, Texas state representative from District 123 since 2015
* César Blanco, Texas state representative from District 76 since 2015 ''(previously supported Beto O'Rourke)
* John Bucy III, Texas state representative from District 136 since 2019
* Terry Canales, Texas state representative from District 40 since 2013
* Jacob Candelaria, New Mexico state senator from District 26 since 2013
* Martin Chávez, former New Mexico state senator from District 23 (1987–1993); former Mayor of Albuquerque (1993–1997, 2001–2009)
* Norma Chávez, former Texas state representative from District 76 (2007–2001)
* Philip Cortez, Texas state representative from District 117 2013–2015 and since 2017
* Jessica Farrar, former Texas state representative from District 148 (1995–2019) (previously supported Beto O'Rourke)
* Art Fierro, Texas state representative from District 79 since 2019 (previously supported Beto O'Rourke; endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Edgar Flores, Nevada Assemblyman from District 28 since 2014
* Red Dawn Foster, South Dakota state senator from District 27 since 2019
* Bruce Franks Jr., former Missouri state representative from District 78 (2016–2019)
* Mary González, Texas state representative from District 75 since 2013 (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Ryan Guillen, Texas state representative from District 31 since 2003 (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Abel Herrero, Texas state representative from District 34 since 2013 (previously supported Beto O'Rourke; endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Juan Hinojosa, Texas state senator from District 20 since 2003 (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Jennifer Jermaine, Arizona state representative from District 18 since 2019
* Jennifer Longdon, Arizona state representative from District 24 since 2019
* Oscar Longoria, Texas state representative from District 35 since 2013 (previously supported Beto O'Rourke)
* Ray Lopez, Texas state representative from District 125 since 2019
* Eddie Lucio Jr., Texas state senator from District 27 since 1991
* Eddie Lucio III, Texas state representative from District 38 since 2007 (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Carlos Mariani, Minnesota state representative from District 65B since 1991
* Armando Martinez, Texas state representative from District 39 since 2005 (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Javier I. Martinez, New Mexico state representative from District 11 since 2015
* Terry Meza, Texas state representative from District 105 since 2019
* Joe Moody, Texas state representative from District 78, 2009–2011 and since 2013; speaker pro tempore of the Texas House of Representatives since 2019 (previously supported Beto O'Rourke; endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Christina Morales, Texas state representative from District 145 since 2019
* Sergio Muñoz, Texas state representative from District 36 since 2011
* Poncho Nevárez, Texas state representative from District 74 since 2013
* Chente Quintanilla, former Texas state representative from District 75 (2003–2013)
* Ana-Maria Ramos, Texas state representative from District 102 since 2019 (previously supported Beto O'Rourke)
* Richard Raymond, Texas state representative from District 44 1993–1999 and since 2001
* José R. Rodríguez, Texas state senator from District 29 since 2011 and Texas Senate Minority Leader since 2015 (previously endorsed Beto O'Rourke; endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* James Talarico, Texas state representative from District 52 since 2018
* Arlando Teller, Arizona state representative from District 7 since 2019
* Raquel Teran, Arizona state representative from District 30 since 2019
* Selena Torres, Nevada Assemblywoman from District 3 since 2018 (co-endorsed Booker, who withdrew after Castro; endorsed Joe Biden after Booker withdrew from the race)
* Leticia Van de Putte, former Texas state senator from District 26 (1999–2013); former Texas state representative from District 115 (1991–1999) (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Hubert Vo, Texas state representative from District 149 since 2005
* Armando Walle, Texas state representative from District 140 since 2009
* Gene Wu, Texas state representative from District 137 since 2013 (previously supported Beto O'Rourke)
Local officials
* María Antonietta Berriozábal, former San Antonio City Councilwoman (1981–1991) from District 1 and the first Hispanic woman to serve on San Antonio City Council
* Alondra Cano, Minneapolis City Councilman for Ward 9 since 2014
* Daniel Corona, Mayor of West Wendover, Nevada since 2016 (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Kathy Durham, West Wendover city councilwoman since 2018
* Noel Gallo, Oakland City Councilman since 2013
* Shirley Gonzales, San Antonio City Councilwoman for 5 since 2013 (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Jocabed "Joca" Marquez, San Marcos City council member since 2018
* Ron Nirenberg, mayor of San Antonio, Texas since 2017 (Independent)
* Bryan Osorio, Delano city council member since 2018
* Manny Peláez, San Antonio City Councilman for District 8 since 2017 (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Rey Saldaña, former San Antonio City Councilman 4 (2011–2019)
* Ana Sandoval, San Antonio City Councilwoman for District 7 since 2017
* Gloria Soto, city council member for Santa Maria from District 3 since 2019
* Roberto C. Treviño, San Antonio City Councilma for District 1 since 2014 (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Rebecca Viagran, San Antonio City Councilwoman for District 3 since 2013
* Nelson Wolff, county judge of Bexar County, Texas since 2001; former mayor of San Antonio (1991–1995) (endorsed Joe Biden after Castro withdrew from the race)
Party officials
* Bonnie Brown, Iowa Democratic Party State Central Committee member (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Derek Eadon, former chair of the Iowa Democratic Party (2017) (endorsed Bernie Sanders after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Carol Little, former chairwoman of the Nye County, Nevada Democratic Party
* Mary Jo Riesberg, Lee County, Iowa Democratic Party chair
Individuals
* Cristela Alonzo, actress, comedian, producer and writer
* Terri Farley, best-selling author of Seven Tears into the Sea and The Phantom Stallion series
* Blair Imani, author and activist
* John Leguizamo, actor, stand-up comedian, playwright, producer and screenwriter (endorsed Andrew Yang after Castro withdrew from the race)
* Maya Rupert, political strategist, writer, and advocate
}}
Bill de Blasio
* Luis Sepúlveda, New York state senator from District 32 (2017–present) (endorsed Bernie Sanders after de Blasio suspended his campaign)
Local officials
* Michael C. Butler, mayor of Orangeburg, South Carolina since 2013
Party officials
* Lachlan McIntosh, former executive director of the South Carolina Democratic Party (2005–2007)
Individuals
* Steve Buscemi, actor
}}
John Delaney
* Richard L. Hanna, former U.S. representative from NY-22 (2011–2017) (Republican) (deceased after Delaney dropped out, but before the end of primaries)
* David Trone, U.S. representative from MD-6 since 2019
* Juan Vargas, U.S. representative from CA-51 since 2013
State legislators
* Jerry Stringham, New Hampshire state representative from Grafton District 5 since 2018
* Stephen Woodcock, New Hampshire state representative from Carroll District 2 since 2018
Local officials
* Henry Marquard, former 2020 Muscatine county supervisor candidate; former Iowa Environmental Commission chair (2008–2009)
}}
Tulsi Gabbard
U.S. representatives
* Dennis Kucinich, former representative from Ohio (1997–2013)
* Ron Paul, former representative from Texas (only in primary) (1976–77; 1979–1985; 1997–2013) (Libertarian)
Governors
* Gary Johnson, former Republican governor of New Mexico; Libertarian nominee for president in 2012 and 2016 (co-endorsement with Bill Weld) (Libertarian)
State legislators
* Blake Filippi, Rhode Island state representative from District 36 since 2014 (Republican'')
* Mike Gabbard, Hawaii state senator from District 20 since 2006; Republican nominee for U.S. representative from HI-02 in 2004; Gabbard's father
*Charlotte Pritt, former Democratic West Virginia state senator from District 17 (1988-92); former Mountain Party chairwoman (2012-14); Mountain nominee for West Virginia governor in 2016
* Kris Roberts, former New Hampshire state representative from Cheshire District 4; Keene Board of Education member; former Keene City Council member
Local officials
* Jameesha Harris, alderwoman of New Bern, North Carolina from Ward 2 (2017–present)
* Bill Paparian, former mayor of Pasadena, California (1995–97)
International politicians
* Tuilaepa Aiono Sailele Malielegaoi, prime minister of Samoa (1998–2021) (HRPP)
Individuals
* Amy Burvall, Internet personality, author, educator
* Charlotte Laws, author, TV host
* Sean Ono Lennon, musician
* Omeed Malik, banker
* Krish Mohan, actor, stand-up comedian
* Dave Navarro, singer (previously endorsed Marianne Williamson)
* Kortney Olson, bodybuilder, athlete
* Redfoo, rapper
* Joe Rogan, stand-up comedian, host of the popular podcast The Joe Rogan Experience
* Esperanza Spalding, singer
Organizations
* Our Revolution Broward County (co-endorsement with Bernie Sanders)
}}
Kirsten Gillibrand
State legislators
* Susan M. Ford, New Hampshire state representative from Grafton District 3 since 2012 (endorsed Elizabeth Warren after Gillibrand withdrew from the race)
* Judy Reardon, former New Hampshire state representative for the Hillsborough 37 District (1984–1988)
Party officials
* Laurie McCray, chair of the Portsmouth, New Hampshire Democratic Committee
Individuals
* Connie Britton, actress
}}
Mike Gravel
}}
Kamala Harris
John Hickenlooper
* Lucía Guzmán, former Colorado state senator from District 34 (2010–2019)
Local officials
* Michael Hancock, mayor of Denver, Colorado since 2011 (endorsed Michael Bennet after Hickenlooper withdrew from the race)
* Wellington Webb, former mayor of Denver, Colorado (1991–2003) (endorsed Michael Bennet after Hickenlooper withdrew from the race)
}}
Jay Inslee
Governors
* Ted Strickland, former governor of Ohio (2007–2011); former U.S. representative from OH-06 (1993–1995 and 1997–2007); Democratic nominee for U.S. Senate in 2016 (endorsed Joe Biden after Inslee withdrew from the race)
State officials
* Bob Ferguson, attorney general of Washington since 2013
Local officials
* Dow Constantine, executive of King County, Washington since 2009
* Marilyn Strickland, former mayor of Tacoma, Washington (2010–2018)
Individuals
* Bill Nye, science communicator, television presenter, and mechanical engineer
; Newspapers
* The Seattle Times
}}
Amy Klobuchar
Seth Moulton
* Marie Harf, political commentator and former acting spokesperson and deputy spokesperson at the U.S. State Department
* Stanley A. McChrystal, former commander of the International Security Assistance Force (2009–2010); retired U.S. Army four-star general
}}
Richard Ojeda
}}
Beto O'Rourke
U.S. representatives
* Salud Carbajal, U.S. representative from CA-24 (2017–present) ''(endorsed Kamala Harris after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Veronica Escobar, U.S. representative from TX-16 since 2019 (endorsed Joe Biden after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Sean Patrick Maloney, U.S. representative from NY-18 since 2013 (endorsed Joe Biden after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Stephanie Murphy, U.S. representative from FL-07 since 2017 (endorsed Michael Bloomberg after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Kathleen Rice, U.S. representative from NY-04 since 2015 (endorsed Pete Buttigieg after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)''
Governors
* Neil Abercrombie, former governor of Hawaii (2010–2014); former U.S. representative from HI-01 (1986–1987 and 1991–2010)
* Martin O'Malley, former governor of Maryland (2007–2015); former mayor of Baltimore (1999–2007); candidate for president in 2016
State officials
* Joan Bolin Betts, former deputy treasurer of Iowa and former assistant attorney general of Iowa ''(endorsed Michael Bennet after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
State legislators
* Alma Allen, Texas state representative from District 131
* César Blanco, Texas state representative from District 76 since 2015 (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Boyd Brown, former South Carolina state representative from District 41 (2008–2012)
* Jessica Farrar, former Texas state representative from District 148 (1995–2019) (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Art Fierro, Texas state representative from District 79 since 2019 (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Chris Hall, Iowa state representative from District 13 since 2013 (endorsed Amy Klobuchar after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Abel Herrero, Texas state representative from District 34 (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Gina Hinojosa, Texas state representative from District 49 since 2017
* Oscar Longoria, Texas state representative from District 35 (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Thomas McElveen, South Carolina state senator from District 35 since 2013
* Brian Meyer, Iowa state representative from District 33 since 2013 (endorsed Pete Buttigieg after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)''
* Kate Miller, former New Hampshire state representative from Belknap's 3rd district (2008–2010)
* Joe Moody, Texas state representative from District 78, House Speaker Pro Tempore ''(endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Lina Ortega, Texas state representative from District 77
* Marvin Pendarvis, South Carolina state representative for District 113 since 2017 (endorsed Joe Biden after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Ana-Maria Ramos, Texas state representative from District 102 since 2019 (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* José R. Rodríguez, Texas State Senate Minority Leader representing Senate District 29 (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Eliot Shapleigh, former Texas state senator
* Nate Willems, former Iowa state representative from District 29 (2009–2013) (endorsed Cory Booker after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
* Gene Wu, Texas state representative from District 137 since 2013 (endorsed Julian Castro after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
Municipal officials
* Peggy Sherrets, mayor of Oelwein, Iowa since 2014 (endorsed Pete Buttigieg after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)''
Party officials
* Jen O'Malley Dillon, former chair of the DNC's Unity Reform Commission (2017–2018); former Executive Director of the DNC (2009–2010); deputy campaign manager for the Barack Obama 2012 presidential campaign; battleground states director for the Barack Obama 2008 presidential campaign (2008); manager of O'Rourke's campaign
* Norm Sterzenbach, former executive director of the Iowa Democratic Party (2006–2013); director of Beto O'Rourke's 2020 campaign in Iowa (2019) ''(endorsed Amy Klobuchar after O'Rourke withdrew from the race)
}}
Deval Patrick
* David H. Watters, New Hampshire state senator from District 4 since 2012; former New Hampshire state representative from Stafford District 4 (2008–2012) (previously endorsed Cory Booker)
}}
Tim Ryan
Local officials
* Dan Horrigan, mayor of Akron, Ohio (2016–present)
}}
Bernie Sanders
Tom Steyer
State legislators
* Gilda Cobb-Hunter, South Carolina state representative for District 66 since 1992; DNC member
* Ed Fallon, former Iowa state representative for District 66 (1993–2006)
* Jerry Govan Jr., South Carolina state representative from District 95, 1992–2022
* Charles Isenhart, Iowa state representative for District 27 since 2008
* Harold Mitchell Jr., former South Carolina state representative from District 31 (2005–2017)
* Russell Ott, South Carolina state representative from District 93 since 2013
* Leola C. Robinson-Simpson, South Carolina state representative from District 25 2013–2022 (previously endorsed Cory Booker)
* John L. Scott Jr., South Carolina state senator from District 19 from 2009 until his death in 2023; former South Carolina state representative from District 77 (1991–2009) (previously endorsed Kamala Harris)
* Roger Thomas, former Iowa state representative from District 55 (1997–2001, 2003–2015)
* Shedron Williams, South Carolina state representative from District 122, 2018–2022
Individuals
* Juvenile, rapper
* MC Lyte, rapper
}}
Eric Swalwell
(endorsed Kamala Harris after Swalwell withdrew from the race)''
Local officials
* Nancy O'Malley, Alameda County, California district attorney
Party officials
* Vikki Brown, Black Hawk County, Iowa Democratic Party chair since 2017 and chair of Swalwell's Iowa campaign
Organizations
* Tri-Valley Democratic Club
}}
Elizabeth Warren
Marianne Williamson
(endorsed Joe Biden after Williamson withdrew from the race)
State legislators
*Andrea Boland, former Maine state representative from District 142 (2006–2014)
* Jill Carter, Maryland state senator from the 41st district (2018–present)
* Gloria Bromell Tinubu, former Georgia state representative from District 60 (2011–2013), candidate for lieutenant governor of South Carolina in 2018, nominee for SC-07 in 2012 and 2014, and candidate for mayor of Atlanta in 1997 and 2001
Individuals
* Margareta Arvidsson, actress, model, and Miss Universe 1966
* Deepak Chopra, physician and spiritual author
* Laura Dern, actress, filmmaker
* Frances Fisher, actress
* Diane Ladd, actress
* Dave Navarro, musician (Jane's Addiction, ex-Red Hot Chili Peppers) and actor (endorsed Tulsi Gabbard after Williamson withdrew from the race)
}}
Andrew Yang
